												Awful framerate, poorly aged visuals(even with mods) and off-balanced stealth vs combat mechanics.The stealth itself barely works because your stealth weapons are♥♥♥♥♥♥and it really doesn't help thta the AI is so god awful, too.My first experience with Deus Ex was Invisible War back on the first Xbox and I honestly loved it.Hell, THAT game plays better than this even considering the fact that it's almost like Deus Ex "Lite" in comparison.The raging nostalgia fan boys are right.This game DOES need a remake.Bad.The nostalgia biotches will likely rate this down but don't waste your time and certainly not your money just for a trip down memory lane or even to see what all the hype was about "back in the day".Just like System Shock 2, it's another game that aged more like cheese instead of wine.The♥♥♥♥♥♥stains in my underwear look better than this game and even though I grew up playing games as early as the NES and am not bothered that much by graphics doesn't excuse the fact that it plays and runs so horribly on a system that plays Alien Isolation and Crysis 2(on MAX SETTINGS) with little to no effort.The best thing about this game is the story, depth and soundtrack and 2 out of 3 of those can be experienced on YouTube and be much more enjoyable than playing this old but not so gold "classic".Game of the year, indeed.....when the year was 2000.

number of helpful: 12 of 56 people (21%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
												Deus Ex is a relic of an older time--and it should have stayed there.No aspect of Deus Ex has aged in any graceful capacity. Its convoluted gameplay mechanics, overwritten story, and trenchcoat visuals were hoary and tired when it was first released, and it doesn't look any better today.Its allegedly open-ended gameplay only offers alternatives if you're prescient enough to bring materials and develop in-game skills on the chance of one, out-of-the-way grate being placed in the most obtuse location possible. Character development is a joke when only one third of any of your skills and upgrades have any use, and stealth is not an option when you can't even tell if you're properly hidden from line of sight, let alone when you need half a game's worth of EXP to develop anything resembling decent stealth stats. (Metal Gear Solid came out two years before Deus Ex; maybe they should have cribbed MGS's stealth instead of The Matrix's obsession with leather clothing.)This game also has some of the most infantile writing ever, hoping you'll be impressed by having celebrated tinfoil hat-supporters like The Illuminati namedropped. If you ever thought Dan Brown didn't try hard enough for REALISM, have I got the game for you!The greatest slap to the face is that Deus Ex is terribly optimized for modern PCs; you have to download a third-party patch to make sure this game looks decently lit. I stumbled around with my Eyeshine upgrade active at all times for over an hour before learning "Hey, this game isn't meant to be THAT ugly!"Save your money. At the time of this writing, there's exactly one good "Deus Ex" game; it carries the subtitle "Human Revolution". This game is an appendix of a bygone era.

content:
Posted: June 14, 2015
												I may get some flack for this one. I'm not averse to older games by any stretch of the imagination - my two favorites of all time are Riven and Thief 2. So returning to this it was NOT the graphics that threw me - it was the controls and movement mechanics, voice acting, and total lack of interest in the story. Steam only records a half hours - but it was my latest return to a game I had a physical disc for and have tried several times over the years.I'm not denying that the game was hugely influential, and loved by millions. I am not denying that at one point in time this game offered more choice and a singular setting and story for people. However it's 2015 and there are literally dozens of other games that anyone wanting this sort of thing could be spending their time on. So realistically - I would not recommend it.Some caveats/exceptions. If you loved the game as a child or when you were younger and wonder if it runs alright on modern OS's it seems to. The keys are mostly re-bindable, I simply don't enjoy the movement and mechancis itself. I should also say if you tend to PREFER older games to newer ones, go ahead and pick this one up. If you being hounded by several friends to just "suck it up" and try this one, I can attest that the fourth attempt and nearly 15-20 overall hours of "sucking it up" have only made me incredibly bored of this game.

												Deus Ex is a game that people will defend forever because of nostalgia, I used to be one of them, but since playing it last year this was the first time where nostalgia just wasnt pushing me through the game to the point of me wanting to finish it.Newer players will most likely not find things fun (SOME CAN FIND IT FUN BUT NOT ALL) Some reasons for this can be:Graphics, this sounds dumb but modern gamers sometimes cant look past graphics, this has been some peoples issue with The Witcher 1, not everyone will care but ive known this to be an issue with many, its why we have remakes, so get on it square enix remake this now.Gameplay, the game can seem clunky at times and has skillpoints that no person would want nor ever need but newers players wouldnt know this, some say this is just a learning experience but others could find this just plain annoying, stealth is AMAZING-ly easy as the AI would make better bricks than guards.The combat is mixed while very challenging which is great, it can seem kinda flawed with weapons such as the flamethrower and crossbow being so good you no need to grab anything else, leaving all the cool weapons just left.Story is unique and very interesting one the parts that hold up today with nothing else like itBut this is a game that has aged poorly unlike something like Quake or Morrowind in my opinionNewer players might not see bad because anything bad said about what people consider jesus just gets shunned away, but I do think this game has many issues mostly to do with age, YES THIS COULD BE APPLIED TO ANY GAME, but my opinion has led me to choose this as a poorly aged game.Best bet if your coming into this game fresh look up some gameplay of the main aspects of itIf there was a mid point on steam instead of yes play it or no dont I would put thatIf you can ignore its age your in luck because this game can be greatIf not move onIf your someone who has played this before and love it, why are you looking in the reviews content:
Posted: September 1, 2015
												I personally am waiting for my refund, and I'll tell you why. Im not going to bring up the graphics, which were good for it's time, but the voice acting is horribly wooden and the "accents" of some of the "foreign" characters are just plain dumb. The dialougue scenes are very reminiscent of South Park canadians flapping their heads at each other in 90's era Hot Topic cotoure, which is kind of hilarious, but I'm pretty sure it's not supposed to be a parody. If stealth is going to be done, then it must be done well, and this game doesn't stand the test of time. In other words the stealth handles like a cow in a grocery cart. It has a great story, better than any game made in recent years and I don't even have to pause to think about that statement, but so do any number of William Gibson novels and there isn't a metric f**kton of saves and reloads between chapters. I honestly wish there was a novelization of this game so I could just read it, because the actual gameplay feels like a clunky punishment. If memorizing patrol routines is your bread and butter, and you relish the idea of waiting interminably for disposable henchmen to stop nose mining and move somewhere else then your ship is in. Otherwise, read Neuromancer and save yourself a heap of frustration and boredom.

content:
Posted: August 7, 2015
												Deus EX-GOTYSee what I did?  This former game of the year is no longer such.  Deus Ex is arguably the most dated game on Steam and in attempt to fool you they stick "Game of the Year Edition" at the end of the title.  I don't need to tell you the Deus Ex series is horrible.  Human Revolution for example, a dog turd spray painted completely gold, is one of the worst games of all time.  Seeing how I couldn't even get past the first level I will keep it brief.+It's a videogame+Cyberpunk+Dialogue options-Messy inventory management-Headshots are not insta-kill despite the game telling you it is-Backstabs are not insta-kill-Which make stealth impossible even though that's one of the game's main aspects-Every "gadget" intended as a weapon is useless-Uninspiring terrorist plot-Jumping is near pointless since most objects have infinite height.  (You can't jump on a chair)-At times an item will be stuck in your equipped slot and there will be no way to unequip it-No auto-saves-No waypoints -No music whatsoeverAvoid at all costs.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
												Boring, lacklustre and broken.  Visuals are dated even with some of the very good mods out there.  Game mechanics, AI and physics are poor even using add-ons like GMDX - Ion Storm should have taken some inspiration from Looking Glass Studios on how to do these two years earlier but kudos to the fan modding community for pitching in some seriously great efforts with textures, gameplay and so on.Even overlooking technical details, this game couldn't keep my interest and I tried for over 20 hours.  It is not an engaging or intriguing story and the characters just aren't likable or memorable.Not only would I not recommend this game to a friend, I would not even recommend it to somebody that I don't like.  Getting an old game like this to run on modern hardware is only worthwhile if the game is worthwhile.  This is a turd that cannot be polished.

number of helpful: 14 of 91 people (15%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 2, 2012
												I was wary when starting this game as it is often described as the best game ever but given its age I wasn't convinced these opinions weren't coloured by nostalgia. Having played through this I can see why people love it but I don't. It doesn't take the usual shoot all the zombies/Nazis/aliens in the face until you win approach it is stealth and tactics focused. You can take very different approaches to get through the levels depending on how you develop your character. It is not an easy game to get into as you are presented with a baffling array of skills with no real idea what will be useful. Once you get the hang of it the game is ok and that is my overall opinion there is nothing wrong with the game (well except the graphics and the voice acting) but there was nothing that made it special. Compared to other games of the era it is way better than shoot everything crap like Quake 3 but it was not as much fun as story based shooters like Return to Castle Wolfenstein or Half Life.
